content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: 0<a.length,b.length<100 should be 0<a.length<=b.length<100 to be exact.

The puzzle is good otherwise

That's cool.

A few comments :

- Agree with others. A string of size 1 is perfectly valid in any language that supports string. But if you want to keep that constraint you need a test/validator case for it (especially because of golf mode).
- Specify in the constraints that string is lowercase. Your problem is not to trick player about that !
- Test 1 is the only case where size A > size B while Validator 1 2 4 are the only case where size A < size B. You should harmonize that (to avoid suprise for player in fastest mode).
- In all cases the substring is at the end of A or B, except Validator 4 where it's at the beginning. You should harmonize that too and add a test/validator case where the substring is in the middle (again to avoid surprise for player in fastest mode)
- Just because i wonder why when i saw it ... abs is not needed in your solution !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice clash

"NOTE: Substrings must be length two or more"
I fell like this is unneeded because none of your test cases have only a length-1 common substring.
Although, in theory it should still count as a longest common substring even if it is only a character.
so the constraints say both strings will have maximum 100 chars but the stub generator has 256...?
fixed, i didn’t know how to use stub back then lol
a character isn’t a string in most languages.i out it there just for clarification
haha im messy with java. ill do my best to revise this.
What do you mean by that? String is just a sequence of characters. I haven't heard of a language which has strings but they can't be of length 1.
you’re right, but consider i added it there just for this problem. If the player can just output a letter then it would be kind of worthless.
